features: POWERFUL COOLING: Delivers an impressive cooling performance of 190W TDP, facilitated by five 6mm high-performance nickel-plated copper heat pipes with HDT technology.
QUIET & EFFICIENT: Features a decoupled Shadow Wings 2 120mm PWM high-speed fan, emitting a mere 24.4dB(A) even at its peak speed.
MEMORY ACCESS: Asymmetrical build ensures unobstructed access to memory slots, topped with an elegant brushed aluminum bi-color surface for aesthetics.
FRIENDLY MOUNTING: Boasts an easily installable installation kit, allowing mounting from above for hassle-free setup.
German Design I German Engineering I German Quality I German Performance
body.description: The be quiet! Shadow Rock 3 offers an impressive cooling performance of 190W TDP and silent operation. It is the perfect choice for design-oriented consumers who need performance beyond the standard for a good price. ▪ Impressive cooling performance of 190W TDP ▪ Five 6mm high-performance nickel-plated copper heat pipes ▪ With HDT technology the heat is absorbed directly by the heat pipes ▪ Decoupled silent Shadow Wings 2 120mm PWM high-speed fan ▪ Emits only 24. design and quality control in Germany

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Impressive cooling and quiet operation Impressive Cooling Power Shadow Rock 3 provides impressive cooling of 190W TDP and is designed for those searching for high performance air cooling and a low noise level. The brushed aluminum top cover with a bi-color surface adds a touch of elegance to this premium cooler. Silent Operation A high fin pitch and low air resistance ensure the best possible performance in combination with the chosen fan. The decoupled Shadow Wings 2 120mm PWM high-speed fan operates at only 24.4 dB(A) even at the maximum speed of 1,600 rpm. Asymmetrical Construction Perfect for silent air-cooled systems: The Shadow Rock 3 can be installed on all popular motherboards and its asymmetrical construction saves a lot of space. The memory slots in front of the cooler will not be blocked.

HDT technology and easy installation Heat Pipe Direct Touch Thanks to Heat pipe Direct Touch (HDT) technology the heat from the CPU is absorbed directly by the five 6mm high-performance nickel-plated copper heat pipes. Convenient to Handle The be quiet! screwdriver included in the scope of delivery helps you install the cooler and the mounting kit on the motherboard easily from above.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Purchased this to revamp my older liquid cooler due to noise. Works great on my i7 8700k CPU. Didnt have to remove MOBO, and installation was strait forward. Along with case fan replacements, my PC is really quiet, and it cools my CPU with ease. i7 8700, 1080ti GPU.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 27, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Silent, High-Performing Tower Cooler
reviews.reviewText: SummaryPROS-Completely silent at low loads, reasonably quiet at max fan speed-5 to 10 degree Celsius improvement over stock AMD Wraith Stealth cooler (for Ryzen 5 3600)-Relatively easy installation-Well packaged-All required tools and mounting hardware included - even a screwdriver-You can add another fan if you really wanted to-No clearance issues with I/O shield or tall RAM-Minimal aestheticsCONS-AMD mounting instructions could use refinement and diagrams that don't show the Intel bracket-Easily bent fins-Fan doesn't have sleeved cablesNEUTRAL-Very tall - check your case clearance before buying-One color option-No RGB optionI purchased this cooler to replace the stock Wraith Stealth cooler that came with my Ryzen 5 3600. While the stock cooler offers good enough performance for daily use and gaming, its high-pitched noise and small fan size gave it a very intrusive acoustic profile (translation: loud and annoying).In looking for a CPU cooler, I wanted a unit with high acoustical efficiency - the quietest possible unit that could still keep my CPU at reasonable temperatures that wouldn't cause throttling under normal loads (so under ~80 degrees Celsius).I had high hopes for the be quiet! Shadow Rock 3 cooler based on reviews, and I have to say it met and even exceeded all expectations. With the same fan curve from my stock cooler, it is completely silent under everyday use (60% PWM at idle/low-load temperatures) and dropped idle temps by around 5-10 degrees Celsius. When gaming, I can't hear it over my GPU fans (EVGA GeForce 1660 Super), and my CPU maintains the advertised boost clock. Even if I manually turn up the fans to the fastest speed, it's still reasonably quiet and is low pitched enough as to not be intrusive. be quiet! includes mounting hardware for a second fan should you want to do a push-pull setup, but I honestly can't see why you would unless you were seriously pushing a higher-end CPUFor $50, the only real complaints I have are that there aren't other color options (e.g.: all black or all white) or RGB options, and the AMD mounting instructions need refinement. The instructions tell you how to attach the mounting bracket to the motherboard, but then proceeds to show an Intel bracket when telling you how to mount the tower cooler. Additionally, the instructions tell you to mount the cooler on top of the CPU before putting on the screws and screwing them in. If you follow that step, as I did, you'll find that there is no room to squeeze the screws in under the large tower and will end up having to take the cooler off first, which is frustrating.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 9, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Better than most and quiet
reviews.reviewText: I upgraded all my fans on my home machine to "be quiet" fans and have used many of their products over the years. 4 years in on an AMD 3950X and this does better than a lot of air coolers that cost a lot more and also the big thing, I have installed several of these and never had a problem with ram clearance on ANY full atx board amd or intel and that's a big thing. No RGB but you cant see this machine anyway since I have to have a full metal case so I didn't want it and could care less. To me pc's should not be seen or heard. Changed all the case fans over from stock to the "be quiet" fans and most of the time you wouldn't know its running and that was the goal. I have also used their cases which are just as wonderful. If your not looking for flashing lights you cant get much better for the money and the heatsink itself is extremely well built and designed. Cools better and faster than most of the typical stand up radiator coolers out there and is capable of twins in a push-pull but you wont need it. If your an extreme over-clocker then your looking at water anyway and wouldn't want this but for a tame high end machine this will surprise you. As always DO YOUR HOMEWORK FIRST AND KNOW WHAT YOU NEED AND HOW YOU PLAN TO USE YOUR MACHINE. No device made will work well if you don't understand what your needs are first.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I've had this in my build for nearly a year now. No problems in all that time.Initial assembly was a mild pain in the ass, but watching a YouTube video helped.It's a very quiet and very effective air cooler. Would absolutely buy again from this company.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 14, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Not For Overclocking i7-11700K, nor for ignoring throttle on i7-11700 locked CPU
reviews.reviewText: The Noise Level is very quiet up past half speed, and not very loud at full speed. You can keep the RPM down around 400rpm completely silent for most computer activity. Except when running Cinebench R23. That will heat the CPU in a hurry.I tried this Be Quiet cooler with an i7-11700 and an i7-11700k CPU, the motherboard was an ASUS Tuf Games Z590. I am a little disappointed the motherboard does not let you set a max core temperate, but that is another story. The option is there in the bios, but it does not allow me to set it for some reason.Temperature Tests I ran used Cinebench R23 multi-core setting to keep CPU busyTests with i7-11700 locked CPU=========================Okay this Cooler will work great if not overclocking, holds i7-11700 down to 74C at 176watts (a little warm)Meanwhile the ASUS motherboard does allow turning off the INTEL default multicore throttle, not good 92C at 194.2Watts. So while it did keep the CPU from smoking, I doubt the CPU could handle 92C for the long haul.Summery i7-11700 (locked cpu):74C at 176 Watts (obeying all intel throttle rules)92C at 194.2 Watts (ignoring intel throttle rules)Tests with i7-11700K unlocked CPU============================i7-11700K not overclocked and obeying Intel throttle rules processor went to 83C at 199 Watts (a bit to warm in my opinion)now if you turn on first level overclock on the i7-11700K forget it, CPU quickly went to 95C at 222 Wattsif you choose extreme overclock forget it, the CPU quickly ran up to 100C at 237 Watts and I canned the test to protect my CPU.Summery i7-11700k (unlocked cpu):83C at 199 Watts (obeying all intel throttle rules and no overclocking)95C at 222 Watts (fast overclock)100C at 237 Watts (extreme overclock) *i shut test down with in seconds, need a bigger coolerSo with all that said, I ran many test and this air cooler, looks really nice in the case, it is extremely quiet under normal load with no over clocking. However if you want to overclock an i7-11700K or ignore throttle rules with the i7-11700 this cooler will not keep up. Which based on the wattage makes sense being as this is sold a cooler up to 190 Watts. I need to get a 250 Watt cooler, which I will eventually do.I can't decide on the newer BE Quiet Dark Pro 4, BK022 250Watt cooler or the Noctua NH-D15 Chromax Black 140mm cooler? Does anyone have any suggestions?Meanwhile other positives, It does not cover the Memory at all, which is a bonus because I love the looks of the Corsair Vengeance Pro RGB memory..If I think of anything I will edit this post, but bottom line great cooler with many positives, but it should not be used with an over clocked or unlocked i7-11700k CPU.
Tres gros, j'ai meme pas pu visser la vitre au complet parce que ca accote dedans, fonctionne bien

Lo estoy usando con un i7 9700, la mayor parte del tiempo mantiene a raya las temperaturas por debajo de los 40°C en reposo, y abajo de los 70°C en juegos, pero al exigirle el 100% al procesador las temperaturas suben arriba de los 90°C con picos de 98°C por momentos, tal vez estoy exigiendo demasiado al disipador pero como se promueve con un TDP de 190W esperaba un mejor manejo de las temperaturas, a las actuales que mencione, que no son malas si tomamos en cuenta su precio

C'est un bon ventirad comme c'est écrit dans le titre mais....Pour les personnes qui sont comme moi habitués à avoir des watercooling et qui ont souhaité essayer un ventirad je reste relativement déçu alors pas de celui-ci en particulier mais de tous les ventiades en général.Très honnêtement pour ceux qui ne cherchent pas forcément à garder un PC ultra froid et qui ont des config de bureautique ou de PC gamer moyen (i5) gros max ce ventirad fait largement le taf par contre sur des processeurs type i7 et inef ça devient quelque peu compliqué à grosse charge.Donc c'est juste pour dire que c'est un très bon ventirad tant que vous ne dépassez pas les i7 et i9 ou alors c'est parce que vous faites des tâches pas très gourmande ce qui peut encore passer par contre pour ceux qui ont eu l'habitude d'être sur des watercooling je pense que vous serez déçu car les températures seront forcément plus élevées.

Der preisgünstige Shadow Rock 3 bietet ordentlich Performance und hervorragende Wärmeleistung.Für den Preis ist die Kombination aus ansprechendem Aussehen und Leistungswert kaum zu übertreffen.Vorteile + Budgetfreundlich + Leiser Betrieb + Passt auf AM5 !!! + Hervorragende thermische LeistungNachteile - Fehlende RGB-Beleuchtungsoptionen - Passt nicht in jedes GehäuseIch kann diesen Kühler nur Empfehlen. Super Leise, Super Leistung.
